results.title: Veronica
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Nine-year-old Veronica Makarewicz leads a double life. Born of Polish parents, she dances Polish dances, goes twice weekly to a Polish school, and talks to Polish customers in her parents’ bakery. But this film shows that she is also very Canadian.

results.title: My name is Susan Yee
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children of Canada”.
A piquant view of downtown Montreal as it appears to a young Chinese-Canadian. Not all guides are as perceptive as Susan, or as outspoken. At home, at school, at play on the Mountain, she has a sharp eye for adult foibles. The result is a meeting with Susan and her city that is enlightening and amusing.

results.title: Kevin Alec
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children of Canada”.
In the mountainous country near Lillooet, British Columbia, eleven-year-old Kevin Alec of the Fountain Indian Reserve learns to make fishnets with his grandfather, and skin and tan hides with his aunt. He goes fishing with his grandmother and horseback riding with his brother. Life is full of wonderful things to do and to learn. Will Kevin eventually abandon his Indian way of life or will it be a source of continuing enrichment?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

group_works.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
group_works.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
The Gordons, with their four children, are migrating from England to australia. This film interviews the Gordons in England and hears of their hopes and dreams. It then spends the first six months in Australia with the family to find out the reality. Reporters: Richard Oxenburgh, Robert Higson.
results.title_for_label: If we don’t go, we’ll never know, will we?

group_siblings.title: It's easier in the country
group_siblings.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: Relays
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Training film produced in collaboration with the US Olympic Association and the Amateur Athletics Union. Techniques to improve relay team’s performance. Looks at the responsibilities of the relay members, different types of baton passes, fixed and running starts. Narrated by Bill Slater.
